name: uncoloured
content:
uncoloured adjective
(COLOUR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
having no colour or with no extra colour added: It is made from the clear, uncoloured juice of the black grape. Cook the onions gently until soft and uncoloured.
More examplesFewer examplesA plain, uncoloured glass best shows off the colour and richness of the wine. They hung a few plain, uncoloured lights in the cherry tree in the garden.If you are taking medicines that contain colourings, ask your doctor if he can prescribe an uncoloured version.

uncoloured adjective
(INFLUENCE)
(of an opinion) not influenced by something, especially in a negative way: uncoloured by Jurors should be able to reach a fair verdict, uncoloured by what they read in the papers.
More examplesFewer examplesCan we be sure that their judgments are entirely uncoloured by personal considerations? Here are the bald, uncoloured facts.I made a calm, uncoloured statement of facts.
